Module org.microbean.type
Package org.microbean.type

Class CdiType

java.lang.Object
org.microbean.type.Type<Type>
org.microbean.type.JavaType
org.microbean.type.CdiType
All Implemented Interfaces:
Owner<Type>
public final class CdiType extends JavaType
A JavaType with a flexible means of describing its direct supertypes, suitable only, probaly, for CDI use cases.

This is a value-based class.

Author:
Laird Nelson

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.microbean.type.JavaType

    • box

      public CdiType box()
      If this CdiType represents a primitive type, returns a CdiType representing the corresponding "wrapper type", or this CdiType itself in all other cases.
      Overrides:
      box in class JavaType
      Returns:
      a CdiType representing the corresponding "wrapper type" where appropriate, or this
      See Also:
      • JavaType.box()
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method does not, and its overrides must not, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • directSupertypes

      public Collection<? extends JavaType> directSupertypes()
      Returns an unmodifiable and immutable Collection of the direct supertypes of this CdiType as provided by the directSupertypesFunction supplied at construction time.
      Overrides:
      directSupertypes in class JavaType
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable and immutable Collection of the direct supertypes of this JavaType; never null
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic, though the ordering of elements within returned Collections is undefined
      Nullability:
      This method does not, and its overrides must not, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • type

      public CdiType type()
      If this CdiType represents a ParameterizedType or a GenericArrayType returns a CdiType representing its raw type or generic component type, or, if this CdiType does not represent a ParameterizedType or a GenericArrayType, returns this.
      Specified by:
      type in interface Owner<Type>
      Overrides:
      type in class JavaType
      Returns:
      a suitable CdiType; never null; often this
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method does not, and its overrides must not, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • typeArguments

      public List<? extends CdiType> typeArguments()
      Returns an unmodifiable List of this CdiType's type arguments.

      The returned List will be non-empty if and only if this CdiType models a ParameterizedType.

      Overrides:
      typeArguments in class JavaType
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable List of this CdiType's type arguments; never null

      Thread Safety:

    • typeParameters

      public List<? extends CdiType> typeParameters()
      Returns an unmodifiable List of this CdiType's type parameters.

      The returned List will be non-empty if and only if this CdiType models a generic Class.

    • componentType

      public CdiType componentType()
      Returns the component type of this CdiType, if there is one, or null if there is not.

      This method returns a non-null result only when this CdiType represents a Type that is either an array or a GenericArrayType.

      Overrides:
      componentType in class JavaType
      Returns:
      the component type of this CdiType, if there is one, or null if there is not
      See Also:
      • Class.getComponentType()
      • GenericArrayType.getGenericComponentType()
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method and its overrides may return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • lowerBounds

      public List<? extends CdiType> lowerBounds()
      Returns an unmodifiable List of this CdiType's lower bounds.

      The returned List will be non-empty if and only if this Type models a WildcardType with a lower bound.

      The returned List will contain at most one element.

      Overrides:
      lowerBounds in class JavaType
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable List of this CdiType's lower bounds; never null; often empty
      See Also:
      • WildcardType.getLowerBounds()
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method does not, and its overrides must not, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • upperBounds

      public List<? extends CdiType> upperBounds()
      Returns an unmodifiable List of this CdiType's upper bounds.

      The returned List will be non-empty if and only if this Type models either a WildcardType or a TypeVariable.

      The returned List will contain at most one element.

      Overrides:
      upperBounds in class JavaType
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable List of this CdiType's lower bounds; never null; often empty
      See Also:
      • TypeVariable.getBounds()
      • WildcardType.getUpperBounds()
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method does not, and its overrides must not, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • supertypes

      public Collection<? extends CdiType> supertypes()
      Returns all the supertypes of this CdiType (which includes this CdiType).

      This method reflexively and transitively applies the direct supertype relation (represented by the directSupertypes() method) to this CdiType and returns an unmodifiable Collection containing the result.

      Overrides which alter this algorithm may result in undefined behavior. Typically overriding is necessary only to refine the return type of this method.

      Overrides:
      supertypes in class JavaType
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable Collection containing all the supertypes of this Type (which includes this CdiType); never null
      See Also:
      • directSupertypes()
      Idempotency:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, idempotent and deterministic.
      Nullability:
      This method does not, and its overrides must not, return null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • of

      public static final CdiType of(JavaType.Token<?> type)
      Creates a new CdiType.
      Parameters:
      type - a JavaType.Token representing the type to model; must not be null
      Returns:
      a new CdiType; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type is null.
      See Also:
      • of(Type)
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in that it returns a new CdiType with each invocation). However, any CdiType returned from this method is guaranteed to equal any other CdiType returned from this method, provided the inputs to all invocations are equal.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • of

      public static final CdiType of(JavaType.Token<?> type, Function<? super Type,? extends Collection<? extends Type>> directSupertypesFunction)
      Creates a new CdiType.
      Parameters:
      type - a JavaType.Token representing the type to model; must not be null
      directSupertypesFunction - a Function that, when supplied with a Type (which will be the type parameter value), returns those Types which are its direct supertypes; must not be null
      Returns:
      a new CdiType; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type is null.
      See Also:
      • of(Type)
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in that it returns a new CdiType with each invocation). However, any CdiType returned from this method is guaranteed to equal any other CdiType returned from this method, provided the inputs to all invocations are equal.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • of

      public static final CdiType of(JavaType.Token<?> type, boolean box)
      Creates a new CdiType.
      Parameters:
      type - a JavaType.Token representing the type to model; must not be null
      box - whether autoboxing is enabled; must be true because CDI requires autoboxing; see JavaType.of(Token, boolean) which this method shadows
      Returns:
      a new CdiType; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if box is false; CDI requires autoboxing
      See Also:
      • of(Type)
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in that it returns a new CdiType with each invocation). However, any CdiType returned from this method is guaranteed to equal any other CdiType returned from this method, provided the inputs to all invocations are equal.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • of

      public static final CdiType of(Type type, boolean box)
      Returns a CdiType representing the supplied type.
      Parameters:
      type - the Type that will be modeled; must not be null
      box - whether autoboxing is enabled; must be true because CDI requires autoboxing; see JavaType.of(Type, boolean) which this method effectively shadows
      Returns:
      a CdiType; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type is null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if box is false; CDI requires autoboxing
      See Also:
      • of(Type)
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in that it may return a new CdiType with each invocation). However, any CdiType returned from this method is guaranteed to equal any other CdiType returned from this method, provided the inputs to all invocations are equal.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
      This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple threads.

    • ofExact

      public static final CdiType ofExact(Type type)
      Returns a CdiType with no direct supertypes representing the supplied type.
      Parameters:
      type - the Type that will be modeled; must not be null
      Returns:
      a CdiType with no direct supertypes; never null
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if type is null.
      Idempotency:
      This method is idempotent but not deterministic (in that it may return a new CdiType with each invocation). However, any CdiType returned from this method is guaranteed to equal any other CdiType returned from this method, provided the inputs to all invocations are equal.
      Nullability:
      This method never returns null.
      Thread Safety:
